item.name: Clusters
item.description: Endpoints for managing and retrieving cluster data

item.name: Retrieves a list of all namespaces within a specific Kubernetes cluster for a given client.

request.name: Retrieves a list of all namespaces within a specific Kubernetes cluster for a given client.

description.content: Fetches all namespaces within the specified Kubernetes cluster. It is primarily used to populate filter dropdowns in the UI, allowing users to select specific namespaces for more granular data views within a single cluster.
(Required) Unique identifier for the client
(Required) Unique identifier for the cluster

response.name: A list of namespaces within a cluster.

item.name: Internal Applications
Retrieves deprecation status of external applications across all clusters for a specific client.

request.name: Retrieves deprecation status of external applications across all clusters for a specific client.

description.content: Fetches the deprecation status of all internal applications installed across all clusters associated with a given client ID. It provides information to help the frontend build a "risk timeline", showing the scheduled deprecation dates for each version of the installed internal applications. This feature is essential for planning upgrades and mitigating risks associated with the use of outdated software.
Filters the applications by the specified external application IDs. Supports multiple IDs.
Filters the applications by the specified external application IDs. Supports multiple IDs.
Filters the applications by the specified cluster IDs. Supports multiple IDs.
Filters the applications by the specified cluster IDs. Supports multiple IDs.
Filters the applications by specified deprecation types (e.g., eol, eos, security). Supports multiple deprecation types.
Filters the applications by specified deprecation types (e.g., eol, eos, security). Supports multiple deprecation types.
(Required) Unique identifier for the client

response.name: A list of external applications with their deprecation status.

item.name: Retrieves the changelog of an external application, optionally comparing two specific versions.

request.name: Retrieves the changelog of an external application, optionally comparing two specific versions.

description.content: This endpoint retrieves the changelog for a specific external application,including the release dates for each version. Allows a comparison between `version_id` and the optional `compare` version. If `compare` is not specified, it returns the full changelog for `version_id`.
(Required) Unique identifier for the internal application
(Required) Identifier for the specific version of an application
